title: TTX Enables Self-Service BI With Kavi Global
text:
Kavi Global
CHICAGO , Oct. 20, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- TTX Company announced the deployment of their Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and Business Intelligence (BI) solution. TTX EDW provides easy, self-service access to accurate and timely information, enabling data driven decision-making capability at all levels.
Logo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20151020/278813LOGO
"I am very excited about this program. Now we can give the decision makers timely access to information that they use to improve productivity and make our business processes more efficient. This is a core capability that helps create incremental value for our customers," said Tom Wells , TTX Company's President and CEO.
"Many companies have started on the path of business transformation with operating models that are digitally and analytically enabled, and TTX is no exception," said Bruce Schinelli , TTX Company's CIO. "This successful deployment is a testament to the commitment of our employees and the excellent services we receive from our consulting partner, Kavi Global." A robust data quality framework, a data governance program and self-service capabilities that include executive dashboards, further strengthens TTX's EDW implementation.
"TTX continues to advance their position as a leader in the transportation industry by investing in Data Management, BI and Analytics capabilities to achieve business efficiencies and generate cost savings," said Vijitha Kaduwela CEO of Kavi Global. To accelerate change management, adoption, and the time-to-value while mitigating project risks, the Kavi consulting team used their Analytics Value Acceleration (AVA) process framework. TTX is a strategic partner for Kavi Global who uses their services for Consulting, Implementation and Operations in the areas of EDW, BI and Analytics.
About TTX
TTX Company is a leading provider of railcars and related freight car management services to the North American rail industry. TTX's pool of railcars – over 220,000 cars and intermodal wells – is ideal for supporting shippers in the intermodal, automotive, paper & forest, metals, machinery, wind energy and other markets where flatcars, boxcars and gondolas are required. Owned by North America's leading railroads, TTX's free-running pools provide fungible assets that minimize total empty miles, further lowering costs and minimizing risk for the industry, helping the railroads conserve their capital for other critical infrastructure needs. Customers easily recognize TTX's bright yellow cars as a consistent, high quality, well-maintained fleet that serves many transportation needs.
